name: BehindTheNet.org
body: This domain once hosted the blog of Josh C., software developer, Virginia Tech alumnus and Carolina Hurricanes/Washington Nationals fan in Charlottesville, VA. I'm still around, but the site, not so much. During blogging's peak, I had lots of time to write and maintain my own web space. Life moved on, as did I, and maintaining an archive of who I was in 2003 no longer seemed worth the trouble. I do other things now. I might choose to write again sometime, and it's possible I'd do so here. But the best places to find me for now are: * Twitter [@joshcvt](http://twitter.com/joshcvt/) is for off-the-cuff talk and pressure venting, more sports than not. If locked down, I'll probably approve a follow request if I recognize you. * Goodreads [joshcvt](http://goodreads.com/joshcvt/) gets reads and reviews since fall 2014, and some back content as well. * GitHub [@joshcvt](http://github.com/joshcvt/) is where I work on some dev projects I don't mind open-sourcing. The current highlight is [natinal](http://github.com/joshcvt/natinal), a Python monitoring system for MLB.com live data feeds. And of course, this site is itself hosted as a [GitHub Pages](https://pages.github.com/) site. The substantive way to reach me is by email. Thanks for visiting.
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
